intro: Mesembryanthemum mutabile, commonly known as the variable ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are often covered in a powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Mesembryanthemum mutabile is well adapted to rocky soils and full sun, making it a hardy ornamental plant.
